wikipedia_page.main: Edmund Thomas Chipp (25 December 1823 – 17 December 1886) was an English organist and composer.  His compositions were principally church organ music and oratorios.

response: Born in Lambeth, Cooper was the son of organist George Cooper Sr. He succeeded his father as assistant organist at St Paul's Cathedral in 1838; having already substituted for his father periodically since 1831. He remained in that position for the rest of his life, also serving concurrently as organist at a variety of other smaller churches. From 1867 until his death 9 years later he was the organist at the Chapel Royal, St. James's.The organ and its masters by Henry Charles Lahee, L. C. Page & company, 1903, pg 193 His students included Canadian organist Romain-Octave Pelletier I; English organists Edmund Chipp, Langdon Colborne, and Henry Willis; and English conductor Henry Wood.
